alert.note: Alert for Central Penobscot (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 5:08PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Penobscot County through 545 PM EDT... At 506 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Lincoln to 7 miles southwest of Howland. Movement was northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Locally heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Localized ponding of water on roadways and hydroplaning possible. Locations impacted include... Lincoln, Howland, Licoln Township, Enfield, Bradford, Alton, Lagrange, Mattawamkeag, Chester, Passadumkeag, Argyle, Woodville, Maxfield and Seboeis. This includes Interstate 95 between mile markers 208 and 236. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
